Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: I really appreciate these Andrew Garfield spiderman movies because they were very serious and had incredible CGI. The director wasn't afraid to experiment with darker tones, character deaths, and intense action sequences. Homecoming was a joke compared to both these movies and I felt it didn't take itself seriously enough. The CGI was pretty bad and it wasn't entertaining. There weren't any memorable action sequences that I would want to rewatch. I feel like the MCU is too afraid to use darker tones and experiment with new ideas because they want to play it safe with the critics. Overall, I truly enjoyed the Andrew Garfield spiderman films and felt that they were much more serious and action-packed compared to most MCU films, which tend to be a joke.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Ever noticed when they add more villains in a Spiderman film, the movie does not do so well. Every time the stuck with One main Villain, it does great. 
 
Villains in every Spiderman Film

Spiderman 1-The Green Goblin (Great)
Spiderman 2-Dr Octopus(Spectacular)
Spiderman 3- Venom, The Sandman, & The New Goblin (too rushed and not to like the previous films) 

Amazing Spiderman- The Lizard (alright)
Amazing Spiderman 2- Electro, The Rhino, The New Goblin (what is this?)

Spiderman Homecoming- The Vulture. (awesome)

Lesson. Don't add to many villians in a film.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: Garfield was pretty good as Parker, he  really added a great dimension to the character. I like Peter portrayed as a normal  teen and not incredibly weak and nerdy. In the second movie the studio absolutely wasted Rhino character, he was miscast and written horribly. The same can be said of green goblins transformation and fight scene with Spiderman, entire thing felt rushed. I like the setup for sinister six too bad it was never realized. I think the character he developed would have been a great addition to marvel universe, I   don't understand why the moviemakers wouldn't want a strong version of Spider-Man to join the cast of characters. Instead we got a kid that needs a lot of maturing compared to already established cast of marvel world.

Comment: This movie wasn't terrible but it was really disappointing. Spiderman was awesome in the movie but Peter wasn't, idk about you guys but idgaf about Peter's parents I only care about uncle Ben and aunt may, I wish they didn't spend so much time focusing on him finding his parents because no one cares. Another thing that was disappointing was the supporting characters like Harry Osborn, Norman, Max. I hate that Harry wasn't in the first film so when they introduced him in this movie they try to make you feel like him and Peter have been bff's forever but it didn't work. And finally the villains were terrible, they made the same mistake spiderman 3 made with TOO MANY VILLIANS. Electro wasn't all that bad but his motivations were so stupid, Green goblin looked so bad he looked like he had face herpes and rhino was a fucking joke. All I got to say is I liked the first amazing spiderman but the 2nd one was completely disappointing. The only good thing about this film was spiderman

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
My idea for the movie would have been that in the beginning, Norman Osborn hires Rhino as the Rhino to retrieve a few, for story purposes plutonium vials for him to create a super weapon that he intends to sell to a foreign buyer. Spider man, having known that Rhino has a mercenary like agenda, stops him and demands him to tell him who is his employer but Rhino refuses to tell and is sent to jail. Meanwhile the board of Oscorp become suspicious of what Norman Osborn is doing and plan to have him removed of the board of directors. Knowing that Spidey would become a threat to him as he recognises the spider DNA enhancements from the genetic spiders, Norman decides to inject himself with a serum and turns into the Goblin. Later Max Dillon falls into a tank of eels and turns into Electro where he heads to time square. During this time the board of directors remove Norman Osborne as CEO of Oscorp which forces Norman to return as the green goblin and kill the board of directors which is reported across New York but not before Spidey defeats Electro and imprisoned him in Ravenscroft. 

With the buyer wanting the super weapon soon, Norman realises that he needs more money to continue so he robs a bank as the green goblin but flees after being defeated by Spidey. Knowing that Spidey is becoming a major problem and that after watching records of Electro in action Norman as the goblin frees him from Ravenscroft and forms an alliance-the same to rhino after freeing him from prison. Norman has finished building the weapon which is a biological bomb that can kill anyone within it's radius and after betraying his unknown buyer, the green goblin decides to use it on New York city while Rhino and Electro hold the entire city hostage to lure Spidey into a trap. Spidey falls for it and is overwhelmed by the three villains but Gwen arrives to help (like in the movie).

 There she and Spidey work together to take down both Electro and Rhino in which electro is grounded and rhino dies. Gwen attempts to stop the bomb from being deployed but is captured by the goblin. The goblin finally lures Spidey to the clock tower and the two fight brutally while Gwen dangles below. Spidey  finally stops the bomb from going off while goblin throws a hail of pumpkin bombs at him.  Spidey slings them back with a web net killing Norman Osborn while Gwen falls down. Since I brutally hate Mary Jane Watson, Spidey saves Gwen from her death. Harry learning that Spidey killed his dad, breaks out Electro where he explains he wants four other guys to help them kill Spidey. The movie ends with Electro saying let's go catch a spider.

Notes:  The plot from the first movie never happened, it is completely different. This is just an idea. Harry was there during the final battle. And the only subplot is Gwen and Peter's relationship. Like I said this how I wanted the movie to go like. Oh yeah in the third one I came up with, Peter dies in Gwen's arms from Harry's sinister six with Aunt May finding out Peter's secret identity as well. this establishes Miles Morales becoming the next Spidey in which it ends with a spider from Harry's Oz formula biting Miles on the hand with him saying "Oh no"

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
In my opinion, if they cut the side story with his parents out and kept the other scenes with harry(to make the second, lesser villain more interesting, which was one of the biggest problems about the movie IMO), then this movie would have been so much better. I think the problem was that they tried to fit so much stuff in there, that there wasn't time to fully flesh out any of it.

I see a few comments saying Garfield is a bad Spiderman/Peter and I completely disagree. I think he is great and this movie being bad was not at all because of him or Emma Stone. In fact, this is probably one of only a few movies where I actually liked the "love story".

But yeah, that is what I think. Cool action, a bit depressing, definitely disappointing, yet still has lots of potential for the future.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Harry in this trailer was way more interesting than the way he was shown in the movie. At least here, his presence and the fact that he's Peter's best friend don't feel shoehorned into the movie just so we can get to the Goblin part. He actually seems more charismatic, mysterious, magnetic and even more of a threat to Spider-Man here - the guy has Peter and Aunt May under surveillance! They had to be under surveillance for a reason but in the movie there's no surveillance and he doesn't even realise Spider-Man and Peter are the same person until he flies onto the scene and sees Gwen, finally putting 2 and 2 together.

This trailer version of Harry is what should have been in the final cut

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
I watched this in the cinema with big expectations since I've watched the trailers a bunch of time. I've also watched the first one and I was severely disappointed with it. But I thought of giving this sequel a chance since the trailers looked awesome. This is the first time in my long years of watching movies that I feel like leaving the cinema while the film was playing. It bored me to death, the film is too cheesy, and it focused too much on Peter and Gwen's relationship. It may be a good flick for chicks, but not to those who seek to see a superhero in action. Rhino, Electro and other villains in the trailers are just a side story. Don't get me wrong, I love Spiderman, and I love all of it's comic book version. But this movie sucks, and if the writers and the director are trying to set apart themselves from Tobey's version, well, they have succeeded in doing just that.. Tobey's Spidey is far better than this Bollywood version of spiderman.¬†
My advice, Do yourself a favor and buy Tobey's Spiderman Trilogy. It's way better than this, believe me. :)¬†

Comment: i honestly for the life of me cant understand the amount of hate on this movie. i absolutely adored this movie. this one and tasm 1 are my favorite movies being a huge spidey fan (hated raimi's cheese fest movies). i honestly feel like people are just hating on it for not being a marvel studios movie and also because the critics hated on it too. i personally haven't met anybody who hated; only people who liked it to adored it. this movie is a spidey comic come to life and i love it. from the dialogue to easter eggs to the costumes to set up for future installments; everything is sooooo comic booky. maybe this is why the critics hated it because they probably haven't touched a comic book in their life. i love marvel studios movies as well but they haven't really made amazing movies except for avengers and iron man 1 and maybe cap 2. everything else is good to okay so i dont understand why everyone geeks out over them and i hope sony keeps spidey and keeps garfield and webb going as long as they can.¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
The orginal trilogy was awful with exceptions from spiderman 2 but that movie.still had some really corny moments. The first spiderman was good and i.admit its a classic but it lacked backround info of how he got his powers and his parents. And i thought they did a terrible job on the green goblin. And i dnt understand at the end how he survived getting hit with a bomb???? 

Spiderman 2 was the best out of all.of them. But i didnt like how he lost his powers becuase it got to hard for him and became a weak corny nerd who wouldnt help somone getting robbed because hes.not spiderman anymore! And i thought is was stupid how he got his powers back becuase of mj. I mean rly what about the guy u just let get mugged? 

Spiderman 3 was just terrible they tried to cram so much into it and it was just a mess. I liked how they tried to do venom but they shoulda just focused on him for the whole movie and.not make spiderman a emo guy wearing eye liner. I also didnt like how they got eric forman to play venom. I thought that fezz was just gonna pop outa no where along with the rest of the crew. And making sandman uncle bens real killer was just bad storytelling and a  way just to get another super villian. And there was just too much crying!

The amazing spiderman is the best spiderman movie out of all of them! They showed why peters parents left him with his ant and uncles. And showed how smart he rly was like in the comics such as making his web shooters. They also showed his sense of humor witch also goes back to  the comics witch in the sam ramis triogy really lacked of and when they did show it ir was really corny! They showed how his powers worked for him and had a pretty good backround on the lizard and what he was trying to do.

The amazing spiderman 2 was a good sequel but lacked alot.of backround info! It felt rushed and lacked alot lf backround info Such as harry coming out of no where and then all of a sudden turning into the green goblin in the last 15 min of the movie along with rhino witch they failed to do by making him a robot and having 2 min.of screen time! I also think that electo was good but his reasonings for turning bad was just poorly writtin and i felt like they were trying to hard to make max a nerd and a nobody! The fighting was amazing but i also think they killed gwen off to early and didnt rly explain wat had happend or what happend after she had died the next scene was her funeral.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
I like the fact that this movie is good, However, It did feel rushed and at times it did have cheesy love scene's and whatnot. Why is Everyone still bitching about "Tobey is the best spider man." Hell to the fuck no, I think Andrew did a Way better job playing spider-man, When did Spidey "fans" known Spider-man to be a very serious character? (comics, Tv show, etc.) Never, He always had something wise cracking to say in the comics and TV shows. I like the fact how Dedicated to science in this one than the other predecessors, He wrote science equations on his skateboard in the first Amazing spider-man. He actually Built his web shooters, thus showing how Smart a average kid from Forrest hill, new york really is. And the fact that people complain about how much of a nerd He is not in the movie, This man BUILT web shooters and found a cure for Dr. Connors amputated arm, He resembles the more modern Peter Parker from the 616/Ultimate universes. Tobey fans claimed to represent the "Classic peter Parker." NEWSFLASH: Classic peter Parker (Even outside his witty spider-man persona) was still a joking and happy kind of guy. They tried to modernize peter Parker instead of copying from the predecessor, why? They used something called Source material, And actually put source material in the movie. So, I can complain less about the movie.

PS: Most likely the scene's cut out of the movie are going to be on the directors cut of Amazing spider man 2, So really who's complaining, I know I'm not.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Finally, FINALLY watched this film yesterday, and I cannot understand all the hate its getting, I thought it was pretty solid. Alright, it was perhaps slightly longer than it needed to be, they might have trimmed it down slightly, but it was so well paced that it didn't feel as long as it was. But I have to admit I expected better acting from Dane DeHaan, for me he didn't deliver to his usually level. Jamie Foxx was passable, he did play maxx Dillion well, made you empathise with him for the sad suck that he was. But¬†Andrew Garfield, Emma Stone and¬†Sally Field were amazing and portrayed their rolls with great emotion, especially Andrew Garfield, he makes a great spiderman. The visuals were also great, New York looked amazing plus the web swinging and movement of spiderman was the best I've seen on the big screen yet. Plus spiderman himself was, wise cracking, mouth running and genuinely funny.
BUT Marvel need to buy spiderman back! Can you imagine what¬†joss whedon would do with him.

Anyway, this movie was fun to watch. I hope The Amazing Spider-Man 3 comes out soon. I waited like 2 years for the sequel to the first movie. So yeah, I would recommend this movie to superhero fans, I guess. I've read some of the comments and realized most of them are hate comments for this movie. I think Sony did a good job but the movie could have been a bit more exciting though. ( no offence ) But again, this is only my opinion. I respect that other people have different opinions on this movie.

Comment: (SIGH) I think this movie made the same mistakes that Spiderman 3 did. Too many villains, in so little time.... Rhino got what, 5 minutes of screen time? And Electro hardly got any build up. One second he's an obsessed nerd, and at the drop of a hat, he's evil....should have just made him the only villain in the movie, that way he would have gotten a better backstory. I also think Gwen's death was too quick.... we're just getting used to her character, and she's already dead by the second movie? Comment: i saw this and i liked it just as much as i had liked ASM; i actually prefer this series better than the Tobey McGuire one; i never read the comics as a kid, i did watch the 90s cartoon, but not often...so for someone who never read the comics, watching both ASM and ASM2 and getting the back story on Peter is amazing. i guess Tobey was the geeky spiderman who just got an unlucky bite from a radioactive spider, but this one (ASM) makes you wonder if it wasn't just luck, but rather a twisted fate that made Peter be the recipient of the result of his father's work, work that got him killed...i don't care what anyone else says, i prefer this over the Tobey McGuire series, IMO ASM and ASM2 is better

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: I enjoyed the movie, really really ENJOYED IT. Good thing I only watched one trailer not the other ones with too many scenes shown. Before I watched it I have read some forum saying there were too many things going on, or too many villains, so I expected it all already so for me its all ok. Its not confusing. And about Harry, its understandable there wasnt enough time for their friendship scenes, the movie doesnt have to repeat everything again what we already saw in the past Spiderman franchise. It is boring if every detail has to be explained. When you watch this movie just use your logic and be understandable. Dont complain too much like you know how to direct a movie or write scripts. Compared to other heavy graphics movies, this movie was much much better. Definitely one of my favorite superhero movies of all time, just second or third to The Dark Knight. And of course, Emma Stone's charisma has a lot of impact in the movie as well.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
So as people know there is suppose to be "Easter Eggs" in the movie giving clue of what is yet to come in future spiderman installments. There are parts which will seem very easy to spot such as how the trailer and movie are different in reference to Symbiote in the vault being in the trailer but not the movie, also having Dr. Octopus suit and vulture suit in the oscorp vault. Rhino at the end of the movie obviously. ¬†

The main one i am questioning is NIGHT THRASHER dont know if anyone has picked up on this clue in the movie but watch when Peter is speaking to Aunt May look at the t-shirt he is wearing it has "THRASHER" written across it with a simplistic drawing.¬†

Love to know peoples thoughts on this and whether it could be something to take note of or just a coincidence.

Peace

The only parts of the film that feel authentic are parts between Gwen and Peter and that's likely only because Andrew and Emma are actually in a relationship outside of the film. The emotional scene where something terrible happens felt like the only part that really had effort put into it and the whole movie truly feels like it was just made to set up the next films. And if that continues, then each film will just be made to set up the next one. When will time be taken to actually make a good movie with a story that is well thought-out? Instead of weird script directions like Harry Osborn "needing" Electro to break back into the same building he was just in five minutes before that and could've grabbed the serum on his way out? And how Electro was treated, he had such a sad backstory and what the film ends up doing with his character just felt wrong. Plus that crazy "doctor" that treats Electro was so awkwardly over the top and not in a good way. I really wouldn't mind this film's flaws if it didn't feel like it was just a mess of footage thrown at the screen with animators working their tails off (and probably not getting paid enough) to make the fight scenes look good. But if people eat this movie up and think it's "epic" then I guess Hollywood will keep trying to make things easier for themselves because they know people will just eat it up because of how good something looks rather than how good something actually is. Maybe I'm just too old for these types of films since I'm 23 and grew up with the Sam Raimi films that had special effects as an effect rather than the focus of the films (the first two of Sam Raimi's anyway). This Amazing Spider Man movie had two or three good scenes but this just felt like a movie made fast and sold to the masses for how it looks and all the hype they've spent millions creating through advertising. Sony wins in the end I guess. I'll just go back into my hermit cave and watch Sam Raimi's Spider-Man 2 again.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
It still amazes me that this movie got mixed reviews as it has, just shows how harder it is to please people now.

I think many people also went in with the mindset it was supposed to be the same edgy sequel the first one was, trying so hard to be dark and edgy (thanks Nolan). A criminal thing many superhero movies are doing of late and I'm glad the sequel felt like a Spider-Man movie again, I felt like I was finally watching a movie with the comic book wall crawler finally done justice. Making it colourful, delightful and fun over anything else. It felt like a proper family superhero film again, and that's why I loved it. It was being what Spider-Man is supposed to be, I could imagine kids watching this movie thinking the hero himself was well... amazing. It really shown how great of a role model Spider-Man is without constantly throwing it in your face like Man of Steel did.

I'm just relieved it wasn't as dark as the first one primarily though. But I'm genuinely surprised it's got mixed reviews. Whether it's from the amount of villains (which isn't even half as bad as it was in Spider-Man 3) or it simply not starring Tobey Maguire (which actual fans of the comics wouldn't give a shit about anyway since he was completely out of character to how Peter's character evolved) I still find people overbloating and overcriticising. I could imagine if this film came out 5 years or so earlier, it would've gotten critically acclaimed, people are just harder to please now and complain about absolutely everything.Ôªø

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
A few things i didn't like...
- I thought Max Dillon was a little cheesy and campy. I didn't buy Jamie Foxx playing the nerd.
- I thought Electro was cool but it would have been better if he was still a physical person rather than just being electricity particles. If he still had a physical body it would have been a more believable/convincing death.¬†
- The people of NYC standing around barricades (almost looking like an arena) and cheering on a fight when a mechanical rhino is firing machine guns
- I loved Harry but how he found the goblin suit, was able to be a master of how to use the glider and all of the suit's gadgets, maniacal laugh, etc. Just the overall transition into becoming the green goblin happened very very fast.
- They excluded what looked like a lot of cool scenes/lines from the trailers
- Rhino's accent. I didn't really even mind too much but why cast someone like Paul Giamatti to have him do a bad Russian accent?¬†

All that aside, for me all the positives far outweigh the negatives and i really enjoyed this movie. I'm going to have to watch it over again but it's probably my favorite Spider-Man movie thus far. I just really like this new incarnation

Comment: I'm sorry, I saw it and it was a good movie, but Andrew Garfield just does not fit Peter Parker. They took what was relateable about him, and replaced it with an overconfident coolkid that has pretty much everything going for him. The movie itself was soul-crushing though, between what happened to his parents, Max, and Gwen, it was hard to watch at times, especially for the parents that brought their kids to see the movie, since Spider-man is a big thing with kids.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: this movie was super disappointing. some really ridiculous and unnecessary subplots. most of the dialogue literally made me cringe. i cant tell you how many times i face palmed in the theater. it wasn't quite as bad as spiderman 3 but it was close. the one thing this movie does have going for it is the action. the action sequences are enough just to go see it. but after seeing movies like the dark knight, iron man, and cap 2: the winter solider im gonna start holding these comic book movies to slightly higher expectations. theres gotta be a bit more than just a few cool action scenes. spiderman has so much more to offer in a cinematic universe in my opinion. they should just stick to a simpler plot rather than going so overboard and stick to a darker realistic tone rather than making it feel like its a twilight love story. the last 20 minutes were cool, minus rhino, just cut that pointless crap out. sorry mark web, better luck on the 3rd one!

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
I think the problem with modern comic book fans is that they expect the adaptions of there favorite comics to be flawless and 100% accurate to THEIR favorite individual story arcs. This Spiderman is an amalgamation of the original spiderman and the ultimate spiderman comics published back in 2001-02. Its not going to have the feel of the original 60s comics. Also I feel that some fans go into a movie expecting it to entertain them like the comic book would, and when it doesn't do so because watching a movie is a completely different experience than reading a comic book, they immediately pan it. Don't get me wrong, i am a huge comic book nerd and an even bigger fan of Spiderman. Its just when i go see movies like this, i don't judge it on if it is a good adaptation or comic book movie, i judge it based on its quality as a movie, period. If it entertains me and keeps me engaged, then its a good movie in my opinion. For example, i loved the first Amazing Spiderman film because it was a great summer MOVIE. The new Spiderman/Peter Parker (The Andrew Garfield one) made me laugh genuinely and he was entertaining, while as Toby Maguire (please correct me if i spelled it wrong), although he gave an excellent performance that in a lot of ways rivals Andrews, he did not entertain me as much as Andrew. Humor has been an essential part of the Spiderman mythos since the begining, and Garfield's portrayal of Spiderman embodied that more. My whole point in all of this is to say that moviegoers shouldn't judge a comic book movie to its print counter part. Its an unfair comparison and in my opinion at least , not a fair way to judge a movie like this. Of course, if you want to critic a movie like that, thats completely fine.

Needless to say, i do plan on seeing this movie, probably on monday.

ASM2 had some epic music in there, but the contemporary songs like Steve Aoki's Pursuit of Happiness and that Phillip Phillips song didn't really fit too well in there. Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Horrible movie. Spoilers below, but this is my opinion: the logic behind the movie was poorly thought out, and this is my reasoning as to why the writing and movie was horrible, and there was no thought behind the characters except Electro. Dialogue was poor, too much Gwen and Peter, not enough fight scenes (they lasted about probably 20 minutes total for all scenes for a 2.5hr movie), and character development sucked.

Plot was based too much on the romance between Gwen and Peter Parker. Barely any fight scenes, no character development of Harry Osborn or Rhino. The Green Goblin is not supposed to look like a fucking GOBLIN!?!? Harry turned into a Goblin from taking the Spider Venom? How the hell does that make sense?! GREEN GOBLIN IS NOT AN ACTUAL LOOKING GOBLIN....The Green Goblin is a character who has enhanced powers from taking the "Goblin Formula", just like old Spiderman movie (with Tobey Maguire and Willem Dafoe), and he wears a MASK people?!!?!? Also Harry Osborn in this movie was a BIG GIGANTIC BABY, and in my opinion a wimp and gave up his manhood when he screams 'HELP ME! HELP ME! *CRIES HYSTERICALLY* I'M DYING, SAVE ME!!!!" Then oh, he takes the venom, and finds the glider of the Green Goblin and then all of a sudden magically becomes the Green Goblin?!?! This was completely stupid, and why the hell does Oscorp own all of the machinery for Doc Oc, Rhino and Eagle...Harry Osborn yet alone Norman Osborn were not mob bosses in the comics, and they did not create those characters/villains. Oh and why all of a sudden Harry's 'GOBLIN' features all of a sudden disappear out of nowhere and he says 'they come and go' and there's no explanation whatsoever about this. They didn't even really explain what kind of hereditary disease him and his father had that was making them die.¬†

The whole story and writing of this movie was complete and utter disappointment, I've never been so let down from a movie. The only thing I give to them is that Electro was good, but there should've been more fight scenes with him, and CGI was amazing. Other than that, I think the movie budget was completely spent on CGI rather than the writing development and the logic behind the character development. Next movie only keep it to one Villain not 3!!!!!! Putting 3 villains made the movie worse.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: I just can't get into these movies. I still prefer Raimi's vision better. I have heard all of the, "Andrew is more like the comics than Toby," but Raimi is simply a better director than Webb. Columbia pushed Raimi into making Spiderman 3 into what they wanted, not what Raimi wanted. Raimi did want more money, but come on...the direction he was wanting to go would have been massive for Columbia. They messed up and now the webslinger has most likely had his best days on the big screen. If you don't agree...you're entitled to your opinion, but I don't know...I just can't get into these films. Not going to waste my money.

The whole film I just felt sad and sorry for Electro. I believe if it wasn't for that one sniper, his life and the outcome of this film would have been much different. Sure he was a weirdo and had some depression and mental health issues but overall I don't think he was even a bad guy - not really.

Even Harry, for all his preppy rich boy whiny bullshit just wanted to live. I mean, you have a horrible disease, a horrible father and horrible co-workers, you kinda get a little pissed off when a person who could help you doesn't.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Every freaking time I hear some guy talk about how the Spiderman movie's ruined forever because Electro's black, I just wanna scream at them to stop bitching. It's annoying and insulting. Unless the story depends on the race of the characters, and race is a vital plot point, then don't get angry about it. Plus, when these guys get called racists and try to defend their arguments, their defenses are just so contradictory. They claim it's not about race, but every argument involves race, otherwise there'd be no arguments. I mean really, listen to this.

"It's not about race" = "It's about not changing the characters' race"¬†

"You may as well change everything then!" = "A character's race getting changed upsets the entire balance of the Marvel Universe."

"This ruins the lore" = "Changing a character's race makes the story untellable."

"It's unrealistic" = "Black superheroes or villains is unrealistic"

"You might as well remake 'Roots' and have all the slaves be White" = "Reality and comic books are equally real"

The reason why superheroes all started out white was because they were made during a time when nobody would make out black people to be heroes. But I guess that this proves something else. The comic book industry has actually outgrown the racist nerds who nitpick on things that have no meaning to the story itself.

Comment: *SPOILER* The Amazing Spiderman 2 is hyped, its such a slow movie...not usually bothered by the pace but the trailer is so misleading, this coming from a guy that enjoyed Drive but at least the director knew how work the scenes. Rhino doesnt even show up till the last 2 mins of the ending....(and looks utter crap) as for the other villains? Green goblin jr a mere 3-5 mins on screen no joke. Electro? Less then 20 for sure. The rest of the movie is set around Peter (not much of his alter ego spidey) & Gwen. The whole series is as if they are setting up for something big like the Avengers but unlike the Avengers release incomplete movies with stupid plot twists. CGI might be better then tbh most movies out there but that alone can't save the franchise. Ps. Electric eels? Lol really?

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: What a disappointing film and where to start! First off they completely wasted Electro... they made him extremely cliche and cheesy, and the sympathy they were hoping for didnt work. The writing was awful, again it was cliche and cheesy and just didnt fit with the film. Green Goblin was executed awfully; Dahn performed brilliant as Osbourne but once he went full Goblin... he just seemed like a cliche'd disney villian that was rather rapey (the smile, lip licking and laugh). Also Rhino is only in the film for about 5 minutes, and "again" he is cheesy and act's like an Arnold Schwarzenegger villian. And most of all there is no real presence of a villian in this film... electro has two scenes where he's actually being "bad" and Goblin appears in it for around again 5 minutes. This film was awfully directed and the music was even worse for the majority of the film. 4/10. Stream the film online for free if youre that desperate to watch it.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
This movie was just about I everything I hoped it would be. It had its share of contrived storylines, but in the end it personified what Spider-man was all about. It was about a boy becoming a man, because of the power's he'd gained, and the responsibilities that came with it. Peter Parker is a character that faces the consequences of his power, and the choices he's made, and how he learns to be Spider-man. Spoilers:




Gwen's death, was expected. But that crack, that crack. Goddamit it was so¬† much more painful to hear when I knew what it was about. I read it in the comics, and goddamn it was painful then. But just, seeing in enacted in the movie feels so much more raw, and to watch her die, and see Peter just break down. God. the feels.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Just watched this film. It's a million times better than the first TAS. CGI is a lot better here too. The plot was a bit jumbled (could've done without the developing Sinister Six plot point, just feels like a cash grab). It's improved upon the first TASM in every. single. way. 'Almost' better than Spiderman 2 (this film definitely has the best action of any Spiderman film to date, though). The only way it's inferior to Spiderman 2 is:¬†
1. Spiderman 2 had a more concise plotline.¬†
2. Music in this film, while a lot better than the first TASM, was still not as good as the old trilogy.
3. Cinematography in this film greatly improved over the first TASM, but still slightly inferior to Raimi's directing (though this one is up for debate).

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
This movie was a mixture of good and bad.
Good:
The action was timed perfectly. It didn't go overboard nor did we not see enough awesomeness.
The Character development of Peter was interesting.
The humor was incorporated well.
Electro was a great Villain.
Acting is enjoyable.
Special effects and cinematography are brilliant.

Bad: (May contain spoilers)
Harry Osbourn's transformation into becoming a Villain felt rushed. He should have been in the first film to establish his friendship with Peter. The movie just introduced us to Harry and then 3/4 in he discovers Peter's secret and then wants to kill him for not getting Peter's blood to cure himself etc.
The Rhino shouldn't have been advertised because i'm sure most of us wanted more than a teaser at the end. Once again, his entrance felt rushed and I would have liked a small backstory for the person controlling the Machine.
The plot behind Peter's father could have been explained in the first film to allow more time for action.
The constant reminders of the film telling us that Peter and Gwen shouldn't be together because it puts her in danger even though they keep ignoring that kinda gives away her fate....

I give the movie 78/100
- Worth watching if you have liked any Super hero movies or past Spider-Man movies.
- Fans of Spider-Man in general should enjoy this.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
I just saw the movie and let me tell you as a hardcore marvel fan it's quite awesome! Just found 2 unforgivable mistakes:

1.-Gwen cuts the f'ing steel strong web spider with her hands when spider man attached her to the police car!!! WTF?! They even show later spider man using his web to redirect a huge water pipe! That shit is strong as fuck!!!

2.-The f'ing spider web is still in the kids project at the end!!! WTFFFFFFFFF!!! Spider man's spider web only lasts a few hours at most! If not the hole f'ing city would be filled with spider web in every building!

And to finish I will say the jokes were plain stupid! They didn't portrait at all the charisma of spidey while figthing. The jokes were forced and lame.

Other than that it's an awesome movie, great music (there's a scene were Gwen and Peter get into a closet and they kiss but it's kind of odd because there's no music), special effects were f'ing cool and the 3D was spot on. Also the Gwen scene at the end was marvelous (although it would have been better if they did the spider web to be attached to her leg and not to her belly like in the original comic) I give it a 9 out of 10.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: This film was actually very good, I was expecting, with 3 villains, that it would seem rushed and another spiderman 3 disappointment. However " SPOILERS " I really liked Electro and his story and with Green Goblin, I know their wasn't much of him but he is going to be in the next one for sure so character development was not as crucial as Electro. Rhino, on the other hand, disappointed me, but that was what I was expecting anyway. The CGI used when the man is in the suit made me cringe a bit and his voice got on my nerves. Overall this film was very good, I really liked Peter and Gwen and their awkward and romantic situations, especially in Oscorp with the "cliche hiding place" and the coffee incident. I will give this film a 8/10. ¬†¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Like a few people here, I just saw this movie and to be honest, It could have been LOADS better!!! If you saw all the trailers,...you have technically seen all the exciting moments. In MY OPINION, Dean Dehaan stole the show and also the chemistry btw Parker and Gwen was really outstanding. Sorry Spidey but you hardly scratched the surface of Captain America: winter soldier. On a bright side, the 3D effects were pretty...amazing!! (no pun intended).

Oh and by the way, there are no end of credits Easter eggs so don't bother wasting time sitting through the entire end credits rather you are treated to a 2 minute never seen clip of the movie X-men: Days of future past in mid-end credits(and damn it looked promising!)¬†
For me,......it's a 5/10 (and I am being generous because of the 3D effects!).

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Raimi fan boys let's get this straight. The most popular complaint is that The Amazing Spider-man is dark. The amazing spider-man was dark because you all forget Peter suffers from depression. He's a lonely guy all he has are his aunt, uncle, and if you include Harry who treats him as an old best friend but pays little attention to him.
After he meets Gwen everything changes. He's not depressed anymore he feels alive and set on living through his uncles words "With great power comes great responsibility".
Webb nailed the first one with the little details and the backstory on his past. Making me eager to watch how great the second will be.
Raimi is a good director I'm not bashing him but he viewed Spider-man as more of an opera if that makes any sense. The biggest mistake was casting Tobey (Yes I said it start unliking this but let's be honest) I speak for many people when I say I never saw him as Spider-man. He was a bland weenie of a character.
I never saw that as a 12 yr old boy but seeing the films now they bore the crap out of me. And I just shake my head at every "joke" that comes out of Tobey's mouth. To sum it up Raimi didn't make a Spider-man movie but a Raimi movie with Spider-man in it.
I'm more than happy with this reboot.
I welcome all the Marc Webb and Andrew Garfield hating ignorant people to write your hateful comments below. I will gladly ignore your ignorance.
Have a nice day toodles :3

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
To all the people who do not like the new 'The Amazing Spider-Man' films... Tobey is gone, Classic Spidey is gone,¬†Sam Raimi and all of the old cast and crew are GONE! Listen i understand that some people do not like 'change' or just cannot handle it, when i first heard about these new 'The Amazing Spider-Man' films i was pissed, and i immediately told myself that the new cast and crew were gonna suck and that the films were gonna suck and i am assume you did also.
I watched the first film and found it great to be honest and i also loved it. As much as i liked the Spiderman Trilogy 'The Amazing Spider-Man' in my mind just is so much better than Spiderman 1 and 3 (not 2 ofc). I realized this after i watched the new film with directors commentary and had interesting things pointed out to me. I am a guy who just loves realism (especially when it is a super hero film) the way Spiderman swings in the new films are a lot more realistic, the fact that he has web-shooters is awesome for me (it always bugged me in the trilogy films).
I also like how Marc Webb is focusing more on a realistic swing style, example instead of just effortlessly swinging 'left' and 'right', Spidey may shoot a web on the top of a building and almost run along it making his way up and then excelling to jump and free-fall just to do the same to the parallel building. Marc Webb also mentioned wanting to just have a moment of 'original to the comic books and spider-man trilogy' style swinging, but he wanted it to be realistic, that was why the crane scene was in the last film.
Also i find the soundtrack a lot more suiting and entertaining for this film, although i miss those awesome 2-4 minute kinda like 'what happened in the last film summary's' before the new film began from the 'Spiderman Trilogy'. But i have a problem with how Peter Parker is presented in the new films, 'A' he is kinda good looking so i do not understand how he is an outcast in high-school and he, to me looks like the kinda guy who would just fit right into a group of popular kids, 'B' he should of been wearing glasses right of the bat and not contacts and there should of been a bit more to do with Peter's Photography hobbies and not 'Skateboarding' -_- So i think Tobey did a heck of a lot of a better job with a believable Peter character.
Although on a whole the new story/plot has to be the only thing that makes me want to watch 'The Amazing Spider-Man 2' as it is more¬†intriguing than the story in the 'trilogy films' and focuses a lot more on Peter's Parents and what happened to them and more orientated on Oscorp. I want to see a much more interesting plot in the new film, more depth into Oscorp and it secrets, a better orientation with the villains as we know there are 2 and 1 let's say sub villain (i don't want another Spiderman 3, 24+ minutes of venom srsly!).
I want to see Parker working for the Daily Bugle in this film and i want to see more of 'his' life and what he does, i want to see a bit more of a follow up to Uncle Ben's Death and His Parents.
Also i just want to see Spidey with the avengers SONY! So to all the haters out there i advise you just give this film a chance, This film feels like it can only just get better at the moment and i think it is almost shaping up to be one of the best Spidey films yet (IN MY OPINION!).¬†

Comment:
I'm trying not to be clinical about this, but I have to say - they've revamped the entire mis en scene to a point of detriment to the classicist spirit of the story. Just like Woody Allen uses the Manhattan skyline as an ode to pathogenic humor, Stan Lee in a cardinal, template-like fashion used the likes of Manhattan, Queens and the good hot mustard - which Sam Raimi staged in full-blown Broadway style steeped in pulsating, tangible culture clash.¬†

While Mark Webb is certainly entitled to his own rhetoric, vision and error in judgment - this still doesn't feel quite accessible. Nonetheless, I enjoyed Garfield's rendition of Peter Parker in the previous installment and I think Emma Stone is just to die for. Dane DeHaan looks intriguing, too.¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: The sam raimi version was way better.. Better Peter Parker (Tobey Maguire), better villains (The first green goblin was actually Norman and not Harry), Dr. Octopus, Venom (epic) Sandman, and New Goblin... I hate how the goblin on The Amazing Spiderman 2 looks like David Bowie, that isn't the goblin we're used to.. and really, I'm not racist, but on Daredevil movie Kingpin was black, and in the comics he's white, now they're doing the same with Electro, WTF??? And Rhyno looks like a maniac transformer -.- This Spiderman suit is almost an exact copy of Sam Raimi's one, but with little color changes and Ultimate Spiderman's eyes..and really all villains are from Oscorp? and dr.Octopus claws and vulture wings are already made???? This movie will suck I think.. Sam Raimi's version was waaaaay better - And BRING BACK Mary Jane guys... They're basing this movie on ULTIMATE spider man, but the movie it's called THE AMAZING spiderman it doesn't makes sense..Also judging by the trailer the electro battle with spiderman looks almost the same as the one on the Ultimate Spiderman videogame.. and even the spiderman eyes from the movie looks like the Ultimate ones..And James Franco played a much better Harry Osborn.The new one looks like he's EMO... THIS is not spiderman from my childhood.. BTW the ULTIMATE spiderman comics are cool, but not as cool as THE AMAZING spiderman ones.. They should base the spider man movies more on the cartoons "SPIDERMAN ANIMATED SERIES" it was one of my favourite spiderman cartoons from the 90's..

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Ok everyone..I think I have figured out how the movie is gona play out..Here it is:¬†

First Half of Film might be like this:
¬†Movie may start with Spidey chasing Rhino in the film to showcase how he has perfected his superpowers..saves Max Dillon on the way..¬†He graduates with Gwen..and still is with her despite his promise to Captain Stacy...¬†He visits Captain Stacy's grave or it could be Uncle Ben's grave to reflect on his responsibility/promise....¬†We see Max dillon being treated like a loser....
Spiderman probably encounters Rhino's threat again..this time around with his mechanical suit...Peter reunites with his old friend Harry osborn...Gets to learn some truth about his father Richard Parker through Oscorp...The reason why Peter maybe under surveillance by Oscorp could be because he is Richard Parker's son or they need his blood to cure Osborn's illness..Harry talks to a dying Norman Osborn about peter etc..Not sure how harry acquires a scar on his left cheekbone..
Peter eventually discovers a secret underground station in the subway as shown in the trailers...realises what Oscorp is going to do with Richard parker's research...I think the above scene could happen either in the middle or towards the end..
¬†
Middle of the film: I think this is where shit turns real..

Max Dillon gets into a freaky accident which renders him superhuman with electric powers..Times Square sequence starts...Spidey neutralises him...Electro probably gets taken by Oscorp and is held captive or maybe temporarily held there...This is probably where Harry actually meets him and negotiates with him to bring Peter's blood to cure Norman Osborn...Electro Escapes and probably is given the suit by Oscorp itself..Harry eventually takes the serum and tries on himself..which results in his mutation to green goblin..

Towards the End of the film: ¬†And now guys..people might ask whether Gwen dies in the movie...I personally think Gwen does not die in the movie...Here is why...the following clue might seem simple but it tells alot.. Observe the scene where Peter fires a web at Gwen's hand and makes a funny quip at her....Look particularly his suit and the condition they are...and compare it to the sequence in the trailer where he dodges the continuos attacks from Electro at the power-plant like place..and when he fights Harry Osborn....His suit actually has differences..His suit looks more damaged when he fights with Electro...Which means that the scene where peter fires a web to her hand, fighting Harry.. might possibly come before Spidey's suit damaged showdown with Electro...And secondly, Gwen's clothes seem to suggest that the scene particularly happens either before/after the Green Goblin fight...Also alot of people assume that the bit where Spiderman lands on a scaffolding and fires a web down with the gears and stuff...they think that it is the moment where he saves Gwen...I think this is wrong!...He maybe actually saving Harry Osborn..who probably gets knocked off from his glider and falls to his death..He may save Harry and send him to Ravencroft...This means that his showdown with electro at the powerplant place is the true climax of the film..this also serves to make Electro the main villain..And I think Gwen ¬†goes to London towards the end of the film..which will probably result in Peter meeting Mary Jane.. And this could probably mean that Gwen dies in the third film..

I could be wrong on this..but all other theories are welcomed..

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Guys, maybe we should stop judging the Webb movies from the Raimi ones until there's three of them. If you want to compare, don't compare the one film from last year to the entire trilogy, only the first from both sides.

Spider-Man 1 (2002) has NOT aged well, for anyone who says it holds better than TASM I just think they're lying, I don't see anything in it that makes me think it's a better film. But it is just my opinion.
Well.... maybe aside from the fact it had the Green Goblin (my favourite comic book villain ever) and J. Jonah Jameson who was done BRILLIANTLY by JK Simmons. But they're the only redeeming factors from a movie that has aged poorly.
Spider-Man 2 however, is still awesome. TASM 2 really is going to have a tough time topping that one, not sure it'll be able to but I'm open for it to try. And I'll enjoy it either way since I liked the last one.

Comment: I'm pretty sure Green Goblin and Rhino will not be a part of the Sinister Six. I have a reason to believe that Harry will die and Rhino will be jailed, so that'll leave one empty door because I'm thinking Rhino's suit is in one of them before he gets it. Two doors already have Doc Ock and Vulture, so that was three confirmed doors. Three more doors. Who could they be? Very doubtfully Electro because he's not really wearing a costume. Mysterio's costume definitely has to be one since he is a Sinister Six member. Definitely not Sandman. He doesn't wear a costume. Definitely not Kraven either for the same reason. It's a different team of villains behind those doors. Scorpion could be the other costume and maybe Shocker's gauntlet guns

Spider Man needs to battle many of his own villains first. Think of it this way. Spider Man faces so many villains first. They all get locked up at Ryker Prison. Have you read the Ultimate Avenger comic book? I have it actually, but I'm not a big fan of comic books. Sentry gets his own movie and at the end, he gets locked up for murder. Carnage is in prison as well. Electro comes along and breaks out all the villains. Then allow the Avengers tie up with Spider Man as they fight off the villains at the prison. ChaosXCraft, I think one will be Mysterio.
I doubt Venom would be behind any of the doors. The original Sinister 6 had Sandman and Kraven the hunter involved, but for some reason, I doubt either of them would be behind the doors and I'm pretty sure it would be just costumes behind all the doors. I'm routing for Shocker's costume to be another one, even though he wasn't a member of the Sinister Six. As a matter of fact, Rhino wasn't either. Maybe his costume was behind one door before he got into it. I'm guessing the other villains happen to work for Oscorp at this time. They created the costumes and stored them behind each of the doors, so they will later become the villains and fight Spider Man. Hell, I'll be even happier if one costume was Scorpions. Can't Wait! Between this and Captain America: Winter Soldier it is going to be an amazing 2014 in theaters.

But Allah knoweth, and ye know not."¬† Not only does this verse establish that violence can be virtuous, but it also contradicts the myth that fighting is intended only in self-defense, since the audience was obviously not under attack at the time.¬† From the Hadith, we know that this verse was narrated at a time that Muhammad was actually trying to motivate his people into raiding merchant caravans for loot.

¬†

¬†
Quran (8:12) - "I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve. Therefore strike off their heads and strike off every fingertip of them"¬† No reasonable person would interpret this to mean a spiritual struggle.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
I like the new suit (Well, technically old suit haha). It looks more to how the original comics and cartoons looked.¬†

The Toby suit looked larger and the eyes looked like he was glaring or squinting. This new suit looks much slimmer (Making him look very agile) and the eyes are wider, like he's curious and makes the costume look younger.

All around, of all the movie adaptations this suit looks the best so far to me (For the moment, won't really judge until the movie comes out).¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Why the Robot Rhino?

- Well would you rather see a 'body-builder guy' in a grey suit? Personally i think a robot suit, as we can see, would link nicely to Oscorp and the death of Peter's parents. We also see other suits, e.g The Vulture. Do you guys not think it would look kind of ridiculous to see a guy flapping around in a green tight suit? Yes it works in comics and cartoons, which we all love very much, but in a film like this something like what's shown' would be more appropriate no?¬†

Although Electro really should be in tune with the comics....kind of contradicting my argument abit but Electro looked badass in the comics.¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
List of Probs People have of the Trailer

1. CGI- not a problem, they have 5 months.
2. Harry Osborn- Guys, Dane Dehan was awesome in Chronicle, and don't worry his hair will spike up when he's the Goblin.
3. Spidey Suit- WTF first people complained of the first movie suit and said classic was better, but NOW you have it so STFU it's beautiful.
4. Villain Quantity- Main villain is Electro and it doesn't matter if he black Jamie Foxx is an awesome actor.
5. Rhino as a robot- For those who don't know it follows under Ultimate in which he's robotic. Who knows? it might just be a prototype and he'll be cross species genetics in later films :P
6. Symbiotes- Sorry but Venom and Carnage ain't gonna be here any time soon.

In conclusion, let's just watch the movie in May 2014 then all have a Tea Party to share our opinions about it afterwards.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Okay im a huge spiderman fan both Amazing and the movies Sam Raimi did. But i most say this trailer really¬†disappointed me. Why on earth did they change his costume AGAIN?¬†
I mean¬†I wasn't exactly thrilled by the costume from the first Amazing Spider-man film but i got used it, and¬†¬†actually quite liked the realistic and raw touch. So why did they change it into this? It looks like something from Ultimate Spider-man the game for playstation 2. It just not authentic at all. I mean yes he looks more like he does in the comics now, but i must admit i liked the costume a lot better in the first one and in Raimis version.¬†
I dont get the CGI either. I hope this is just a first bad trailer.. I mean the movie may be good anyway. But as for the CGI goes i must say the last amazing spider-man already looks 10 times better ¬†than this one.¬†

Im really disappointed.¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: I find it funny that the monologue at the beginning showcases the exact same themes that the original trilogy used, almost copying them. I know there isn't a huge pool of history to choose from with Spiderman (lies), but the whole "I'm getting more powerful so my enemies are more powerful so I must be more powerful to protect people who aren't powerful" thing is getting a bit stale. I also liked Toby a lot more in the roll of Spiderman. I don't think they buffed him up enough, but personality wise he was a lot closer to Peter Parker. That said, some of these action set pieces look really incredible, and it I'm not going to lie and say the ones in the original trilogy were even close to these. I just wish I could actually sympathize with this Spiderman.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
This seems REALLY good and I love the villain they're choosing for this one. As for Harry's character, I'm curious where the movie is going to take this. I'm hoping that the movie improves Harry from the first three spider-man live action films, because I absolutely HATED that version of Harry. He was nothing, but a shallow and spoiled whiny brat, who only cared for no one, but himself. As the Oblingoblin there wasn't anything threatening about him either (in fact, Harry would probably be one of the lamest villains ever).¬†

I did look into some articles about this new Harry and, so far, I'm very impressed. People seem to be getting too critical over this new Harry, but I see alot of potential with this. I'm hoping this movie doesn't disappoint me.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: For all the people bitching, please read the comics. No, he wasn't a jock but after the spider bite he did get super strength(check the comics its there). Toby Maguire actually had a similar physique to the original spider-man, comic average build that got enhanced by his spider bite. The biggest problem with this flick for me is ignoring the reason why peter does, what he does - "with great power comes great responsibility". Also canister shooters? - this was ret-conned in the amazing spider-man and even creator Stan Lee thought it was a no brainer(he even said that when he created him he didn't include the power to shoot web naturally, in order to focus the readers attention on peters' scientific skill that he will use through out the series), after all he did get super powers from a a spider bite.( by the way - I grew up reading the original spider-man comics and watching the fox-kids cartoon and never liked the web-canisters, so I'm not knocking it for no apparent reason. just never liked the fact that he didn't have the power to make the web naturally.)¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: In my opinion, I believe this new Spider-Man really sums up the whole movie. If you think about it the other guy who played the old Spider-Man didn't really seem to fit the role. Yes, the old Spider-Man movies were pretty good, but I think that the new Spider-Man movies really make the audience stay at the edge of their seats. This new Spider-Man really captures what the comics were all about and gives it a new perspective on how the role of Spider-Man should be played. The old Spider-Man looked as if he was to fragile and didn't play the part as the heroic type described in the comics or books. This new Spider-Man seems to do the trick.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: In all honesty I prefer the way the director approached this version of Spider-Man. "The Amazing Spider-Man" feels like the comic book actually came alive, while the old trilogy just forced Spider-Man to come alive when it fell apart in many ways. Everybody says they miss Toby, but he fell short as Spider-Man. He was boring and tried to hard to look like a Spider-Man. Andrew though, actually looks like the actual high school Spider-Man, not some man in his late 20's. Yes this looks more cartoony, but that's how it's supposed to be.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: This is what the ten year old me wanted to see in the Toby Maguire god awful portrayal of Spider-Man.. I mean come on he was that much of a wet blanket he made Ben Reilly look like he smiled more. Oscorp creating a realistic technological¬†premise for the Vulture, Doc Oc, Rhino, Goblin and Electro that would work in a movie. I mean come on seeing some guy run around robbing banks dressed in a rubber Rhino outfit is "totally going to work" outside of comics and the 616 universe. Earth-120703 looks like the best cinematic Marvel Universe. Unlike the X-Men movies (Earth 10005)¬†that just collapsed under their own weight like the 90's Comics did. I mean Origins, X1 and X2 were good but the rest were unneeded pointless storylines and had no actual point except to make money and were dead end storylines. Also kind of destroyed any complex foundation that could of made those movies a lot better. Also if people are complaining about this Spider-Man reboot series,¬†I doubt people aren't as impressed as me hearing rumours that after amazing 4 they are planning on rebooting Spider-Man again back into Earth 199999 (Avenger movie-verse) since there is a deal in place to buy the rights back later in the decade.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: SO I clearly see Rhino, Electro and Green Goblin in the film with the Harness for Vulture and Doctor Octopus in the background. A closer look at images of the screen at :52 reveal Dr. Morbious file(Morbious from the comics, and the canon video game that came out with The 1st film already established Dr. Morbious as loving bats), A Dr. Connors file and a Venom Storage. We also see Harry entering into a lab area(Harry is rumored to become The Hobgoblin) as well so everything is in place for The Sinister Six. My guess is the 3rd film will feature Vulture and Doctor Octopus and will reveal Venom(who will get his own film to further his character.) All parties return for The 4th and final film which will feature The SInister Six with Venom, Hobgoblin, Morbious and Lizard helping Peter against The Sinister Six as at this point they realize just how much the world needs Spider-Man. At least that is how I see this whole thing going.

Comment: For all those who think there are too many villans (POSSIBLE SPOILER) Rhino is only in about two or three scene to introduce the character. Green goblin is only in the climac. Electro is the main character. This all came from Marc Web at SDCC. This is gonna be a great movie.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Three villains, eh? This series is going down faster than the last Spider-Man film series. You'd figure they'd learn from past mistakes. Electro and Rhino are more than likely getting zero character development and will be evil for evil's sake, and the film will probably spend a lot of screentime developing Green Goblin, rehashing the dynamic we saw in the first trilogy, cramming it all into one film opposed to three.

Love the new costume for Spidey, though, at least they got that one thing right.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: See so many people complaining about the use of CGI. Look at every other film based on the Marvel universe, all of them are full of it, yet only now do people come out in their droves to complain about it. Not that those complaints can be justified either, to try and do the majority of stunts and what not without CGI would be near impossible.¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Lol wut. That dislike bar should be a lot higher. You're paying to see big dumb Hollywood remakes (say what you will but all they did was change the villains around... same basic idea done worse but with more special effects and "epicness") of decent movies by Sam Raimi. Spiderman is NOT some big, epic saga like fucking Avengers (which itself isn't epic either, but...). Raimi captured the perfect atmosphere for Spiderman to be set in; it is a character story more than anything. Yet these movies just make Spiderman Generic Hollywood Action Hero # 235325 and put Generic Hollywood Villains against him with Generic Hollywood Attractive Love Interest and Generic Other Characters for good measure. There is no genuine creativity or heart behind any of this, just a bunch of Hollywood producers shoving in shit that dumb masses wanna see. Ask yourself: if this movie had NO computer effects at all, would it still be a "good" movie? Yes the Sam Raimi film had special effects but it was more about what went on BEHIND the fighting and WHY the fighting was done and not just Spiderman beating up Jamie Foxx in a shitty costume (a la Arnold Fuckhislastname as Mr. Freeze) because ACTION!

Fucking hate you people and your lack of wanting something better for yourself. All you do is shovel shit in your mouths and accept it as long as Hollywood sprinkles some sugar on top. Fuck that. This is entertainment at its basest and most trivial levels; if you pay to see this movie and are excited to see it, you are without a doubt a drooling moron. Sorry, that is fact. You can still want to see it but please download it for free... do NOT pay Sony to watch this schlock that looks and feels like a computer program put it together. You are actually killing everything that makes humanity awesome by doing so, and I would punch you between the eyes if I saw you hand money to see it.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Is it me or does this seem like a by-the-numbers type saga now, instead of actually artistic... like Raimi's original classics? I mean, seriously, how is this new Spider-Man any different than watching Twilight? Only, this is for comic book geeks... not tween girls obsessed with vampires.

I don't know. This just feels kind of boring. I mean, there's no character in any of it that we didn't see in the Fantastic Four. Here's Bad Guy #1, how is Spider-Man gonna stop him? Oh, there's the answer, before we even get to know Bad Guy #1. Sounds like it's really worth 12 to 15 dollars of my money.

Movies are about characters. NOT about how many cool fight scenes our hero can have with the villains.

Love or hate Tobey and Kirsten... but there was CHARACTER in their relationship. There was even character in their first kiss... which has become an iconic image that these latest movies can't seem to top.

Comment:
Jesus said, I am the way, the truth and the life and no man comes unto the Father but by me. The word (Jesus) was with God, The same was in ¬†the beginning with God. and was God. All things were made by Him and without Him, was not anything made that was made. John 1:1- 3
Jesus is not merely a prophet and He was never an angel nor a spirit being that was produced by God the Father having relations with a female deity as the Mormon church purports. Jesus or Yahshua is God. Yahshua means, Yah or Yahweh (Yah is the contraction form of Yahweh) is salvation or Yahweh saves.
After Thomas, saw Jesus Christ risen from the dead, he said, My Lord and My God to Jesus (John 20:28). Jesus did not rebuke Thomas or attempt to stop him. Indeed, Jesus never rebuked anyone for worshiping Him. The Bible states that you are to worship, the LORD your God, and Him alone you shall serve. If Jesus was not God, He would have never allowed anyone to worship Him.
Acts 20: 28 states: Take heed therefore unto yourselves and to all the whole flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers to feed the church of God which He (God) hath purchased with His own blood. Who shed His blood on the cross in order to redeem or purchase us? Jesus. Patently, this verse (Acts 20: 28) demonstrates that Jesus Christ is God!
Jesus said that if ye have seen Me, ye have seen the Father and the Father and I are one. Because there is only God who is triune in nature.¬†
The Father is Yahweh, the Son is Yahweh and the Holy Spirit is Yahweh.
Genesis 19: 24 states:
Then the LORD (Yahweh) rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the LORD (Yahweh) out of heaven; In this Scripture we can obviously see that there are two Persons in two different locations who are called LORD (Yahweh).
Furthermore, this is corroborated in Mathew 28: 19:


Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost:

Notice: The aforementioned verse does not say baptize them in the names (plural), but in the name (singular). Because the Father is God (Yahweh), the Son is God (Yahweh), and the Holy Spirit is God is God (Yahweh).

Jesus was not merely a prophet, nor an angel, nor did He have a beginning.
When Jesus said, before Abraham was, I AM, He boldly declared His deity. Jesus did not say before Abraham was, I was or I have been as the New World Translation erroneously prints, but before Abraham was, I AM ( ŒïŒ≥œâ ŒïŒπŒºŒπ ). John 8: 58
Afterwards those who were listening picked up stones to kill Him. Why? Because Jesus identified Himself as God. When Moses asked God (YAHWEH) Who shall I say sent me, God told Moses to tell his fellow Hebrews ¬†that I AM sent you. Exodus 3: 14

This is why Jesus Christ's suffering and death on the cross was such a tremendous sacrifice. The Creator (all things were made by Him) died for His creation. This is confirmed by the following verses.

Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God: Phil 2: 6
¬†not robbery to be EQUAL WITH GOD! The only way one can be equal to God is if He is God. (The word was God ... Jesus is the word of God).
¬†Phl 2:7
But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:

¬†Phl 2:8
And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.
¬†God, Himself- the Second Person of the Holy Trinity, came down as a man and died. God did not send down an angel or a pre-existent angel or spirit being that was produced by Him having relations with a female deity. As we saw earlier in Acts 20: 28 that God, (namely the Second Person of the Holy Trinity- Jesus Christ), purchased the church with His own blood. God the Son (Jesus Christ) came down as a man and shed His own blood to purchase the church (those who have received Christ as their Savior). Why would God pay such a tremendous price? Love! God is not willing (desiring) that anyone should perish (suffer in eternal torment in hell). For God so LOVED the world ¬†that He gave His only Son that whosoever (means anyone) ¬†believes in Him should not perish, but have everlasting life. John 3: 16
How does one receive Jesus Christ as their Lord and Savior?
Repeat the following prayer to God.
Jesus, I ask you to forgive all of my sins, everything wrong that I have ever done, all wrong thoughts, wrong actions and wrong words and for not doing the things that I should have done or said. Forgive me. Come into my heart and live in me by your Spirit. Help me to know and turn away from that which displeases You. Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Tobey McGuire was the better Peter Parker, for the first two films. It's difficult watching this new guy... well, at least they don't seem so focused on showing his face.

This is the ugliest rendition of Electro I've ever seen, but just like TDKR's Bane, that can be made up for by how well he's written and how imposing the actor is.

The special effects look kind of bad, but sort of like a comic book, which could be a nice plus. Time will tell.

Not to thrilled with Mary Jane replaced by Gwen Stacy, but then they don't want this to be a complete rehash of the Raimi films.

People who say all the Raimi films were bad didn't watch the first two; Spider-Man 3 just left a mark on the internet that people always bring up. The first two were quite good; the first was one of the best superhero adaptions out at the time, and the second had/HAS one of the most impressive superhero fight scenes in existence, with only The Avengers and Man of Steel coming close.

People complaining about the new suit and the look of this movie are dumb.

This series is colourful, enjoyable +¬†most importantly FUN. Like the comics! Andrew Garfield is a brilliant Spider-Man (and can actually be taken seriously as a teenage student unlike Tobey Maguire who was way too old.) The first Amazing Spider-Man was great and this looks a thousand times better. Can't wait!

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
God that costume looks awful! It looks like something I bought at Party City (is that supposed to be the point?) for $35. It looks like ASM from Shattered Dimensions...

And Sony looks more involved in this movie... which, if Spider-man 3 is any indication, does not bode well. Seriously, 3 villains? Didn't anyone learn from Spider-man 3 that it ruins the pacing of the movie? And it seems like a CGI actionfest (again that screams Sony to me). Everyone should look towards Spider-man 2 as an amazing blend of action and storytelling that stayed true to the flavor of the comics. The last Amazing Spider-man didn't feel like ASM at all... more like Ultimate Spider-man or some angsty modern comic that feels so whiney at times. Hopefully I'm proved wrong and this movie is fantastic, but it looks pretty bad right now.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Oh jeez, can everyone stop crying? To those hating on Tobey and saying he was nothing like the comics, GTFO. All that tells me is that you've never read a dang comic book. The guy who loves and supports Aunt May, goes out of his way to help and support people, and has a severe case of the Parker Luck is "nothing like the comic?" Oh please. If anything I'd say he was closer (anything's closer than Peter helping you-know-who's death along in the last film and treating May like shit). There's a reason Spider-Man 1 and 2 are frequently on best comic book films of all time lists. Hating on things doesn't make you cool, it makes you pathetic.


To those hating on Andrew, ik the first movie really wasn't that great, and all my fellow comic fans will know that at times it was absolutely nothing like the Spidey we know. However, everyone deserves a second chance, and the first film DID have some good qualities to it, so let's not completely comdemn this film. If anything we can wait til we see reviews to decide whether it's worth it, but let's stop saying it sucks before it's even out.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
I also just realized a couple of sad things;

One, Jamie Foxx... Two, Paul Giamatti as well... Talents just cashing in if you ask me...

Also, Hans Zimmer is now doing the score? He's been rapidly losing his credibility over the last few years. Making a lot of similar-sounding scores and just being hired for being a popular name now. Where was all this interest when he did 'The Lion King' and 'The Prince of Egypt'??... But nooo, "The Dark Knight" is way more important. Fantastic score, but that the only reason they now pulled him in for Spider-Man... Oh, not to mention going up against Danny Elfman (an overly hated but genius composer) his score. There's no contest, he was perfect for that, Hans Zimmer is basically a "miscast" out of pure popularity.

Anyway, eeeveryone is going to disagree (except the ones who know what I'm talking about) out of pure ignorance and fanboyism of course. :P
It's just... pf, you can just tell these people are there for the money (probably because of big offers from Sony), but out-of-place and aren't really right for the job, and actually even above this movie.

Oh well... Thanks a lot Hollywood...

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Credit where it's due, everyone's trying, some little details are better and the new suit is definitely an improvement over the first one. Unfortunately it's not enough to stand out from what we saw in the early 2000. I don't like the delivery on the lines, the Oscorp feel is very 'Ultimate' and Elektro's lines feel inappropriate. The scale of the character and conflict is being oversold: this is Spiderman, not the Avengers. A personal struggle, not an end-of-the-world scenario.
This is not the reboot we need. The reboot we need sees Spidey incorporated into the complete Marvel movie universe Iron Man kickstarted. Until then it's just rehash of what Tobey did better.

all this stuff ex: Peter having multiple girlfriends (gwen being one of em) / Web shoorters he made due to the fact that like his dad, hes a freakin genius who used science tech and oscorp resources to make these devices among others / and a scientific company ahead of its time aint something new ( apple company with ipods and iTunes around and yet we still buy CD's....crazy huh. anywho..... much better spiderman, MUCH better young peter..... follow the char and comics instead of listenin to hollywoods first Idea of throwing big names on screen and who gives a shit approach....cause , there famous! : /
