Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
This trailer looks awesome, now I could be just biased, because Spider-man is one of my favorite super heroes, but this looks so cool. It looks like they got the posing on point, the costume looks great, maybe the eyes are a lil too big or a lil strange looking at certain angles, but it‚Äôs the costume fans have been waiting for.

The CG looks good, a lil fake, but what are you expecting a real guy go out and perform these stunts? I understand people‚Äôs concern with cg and hey I wish a lot of people could actually do a performance like what is shown in real life, but I‚Äôm guessing the cg is still not 100%, since they have till May of next year of post production.

¬†Tbh I didn‚Äôt really like Andrew Garfield in ASM, yes he has the look of a perfect Spider-man/Peter Parker, tall, skinny, lanky, with a little bit of muscle, but he was way to awkward for me and very quiet. I know Pete is an awkward guy, but he had friends, he wasn‚Äôt completely socially awkward. It looks like Andrew stepped his game up in this one.

I see a lot of people complaining about rhino, Rhino was a guy in a Mechanical suit in the Ultimate version in the comics¬† (which a lot of the movie costumes are based off of) but this does look a lil too transformerish for me. I guess I‚Äôll just have to wait and see. I also think they made him mechanical, because Sony doesn‚Äôt have the best cg artists around, they‚Äôre good, but not the best and the lizard in the last movie looked super fake, but it‚Äôs a fucking 7 ft. tall lizard, so I understand why it looked fake, but I think Sony should try and get the guys who do the Hulk in the Avengers movie, because that‚Äôs as real as a hulk in the movies is gonna get, unless they go back to body builders in green pant. So maybe it was easier for them to make him mechanical.

My other concern is Jamie Foxx, great actor, I enjoy a lot of movies he‚Äôs been in, but he seems too calm to be Electro, the Electro I know is crazy, loud and seems like a psychopath, I‚Äôm hoping they haven‚Äôt showed the best of him yet.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Here's the thing that bothers me ... starting with the Batman series with Michael Keaton in 1989, there seems to have been a precedent set, where the more sequels you have, the more bad guys you have to cram into a movie. I think the only one that has handled multiple baddies well has been the more recent Christopher¬† Nolan vision of Batman. Just because it was sort of well managed into the story and not a "hey, we have completely different goals, but lets join forces to kill the hero" sort of plotline. The Tobey Maguire sequels are a great example of that. Why did the morally sound¬†Sand Man, who was only doing bad stuff for the sake of his family, join forces with Venom?¬†Just because.¬†Don't ask questions.¬†

So this movie is going to jam in¬†Electro, Rhino AND a Goblin? I have my doubts they will be able to present all of that in a way that doesn't just seem like a bad tradeoff between action and story. The way to make a good movie is to have the story drive the action, not the other way around....

Also, seems like they are trying to avoid the bad guys from the last series, except now the Goblin ... but I would really love to see a re-envisioning of Venom, because Spiderman 3 did a terrible, terrible job with it.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
These comments are making me pull my hair out. Half the people commenting are the most judgemental idiotic pessemistic un-educated comments ever.

First of all, the problem with Spiderman 3 wasn't that it had too many villians, it was the bad writing.
Second, whats wrong with the CGI? Audiences have been so hypotised by realistic special effects that all of a sudden if they try to make it look more comicbook-like or colourful it's shit? Nah.
Thirdly, Electro and Rhino look fucking awesome and perfectly fit in to this universe that Marc Webb is creating. They're both based off their Ultimate Universe counterparts because their mainstream counterparts would just look ridiculous. Let's be realistic.
And finally, those saying that Sony are just making this for the money are so damn naive it hurts. If you look up information and listen/read to what Marc Webb and his team are doing. Simply put they're planning an incredible story and it's going to be awesome.

Remember we still have 4 months to wait till release date, stop being so fucking ignorant and wait till the damn film comes out to judge it.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
The movie looks awesome from the trailer but I'm worried about a few things:
1) The posters seem to imply Harry Osborn will be the original Green Goblin. If that's true that's a gutsy and controversial choice that could potentially mess up the storyline if not handled carefully.
2) Electro seems to have a smaller role than we anticipated judging by the trailer.
3) 3 major villains in 1 movie? I hope Marc Webb plays this one REALLY carefully because that was a fatal flaw in Sam Raimi's "Spider-Man 3" that helped fuck up the movie.

Given how many villains there are I expect at least 1 to die. I don't want it to be Electro, because he seems the most interesting of the 3 so far, but I have a feeling he's the most likely candidate. Rhino is a later villain and Green Goblin is a very important and pivotal villain for Spidey. He's too important to be offed in one movie shared with other villains taking up screentime. He would require a movie where he's Spidey's only villain before he's killed off, like Sam Raimi's first Spider-Man movie. Rhino is the villain I'd personally be least upset about dying.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
People complaining about CG make me laugh. You really think the agility and acrobatics at the speed of Spider-Man is something that can be practically filmed? The last sequence cannot be done practically. Ever. No human can do that. Best they could try was have a guy swing around a little bit in the first movie and that looked alright at best.

Complaining about CG is valid when the CG is being used for lazy reasons. In this case, without CG, you can never get to see Spidey be Spidey.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: "Amazing" is just a title change to differentiate THIS series from Raimi's "Spider-Man" trilogy. Just like "Ang Lee's Hulk" (2003)¬†and "The Incredible Hulk" reboot (2008). Marc Webb took some elements of "Ultimate Spider-Man" along with his own ideas and interpretations and used them to create the new universe for "The Amazing Spider-Man". Spider-Man 4 was going to happen, but Tobey Maguire had back problems, Kirsten Dunst didn't want to get her teeth fixed and Rami was pretty much done with the story he told. The series was good only because its what we grew up with. It was great for ITS time. Its 10 years later, YOU are not who you were 10 years ago, so why should Peter Parker/Spider-Man be any different? In the comics there are over 100 different dimensions and universes. Who is to say this isn't a different one all together? This wont be a "Spider-Man 3". The problem with that movie was that those 3 villains had no connection and no real reason to team up and Venom was not done justice. The comic books are easily able to adapt many characters and with the right direction and story, so can it be¬†on film. In this film, all of these villains have OsCorp in common. OsCorp is the common denominator, there is reason for these villains to exist. There is a reason why this¬†new series¬†is called "The Spectacular Spider-Man in other countries. Has anyone seen the cartoon of the same name? It is the same plot! Bottom line, Spider-Man is Spider-Man and this is going to be a great film.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
This does look great but... there is so many villains...and it looks like the writers have bundled all their amazing back stories into one plot point that is Oscorp. So instead of each villain having a relatable background from the comics, the reason for their powers, abilities and move over to the bad guy zone are shoved together together as a creation of a corporation. Electro, Rhino, Venom (0:52 look for venom project), Vulture, Dr. Octopus and Green Goblin. Great characters that could be ruined by becoming instantly two dimensional. ¬†Seems like a quick lazy way to throw some bad guys together, make something like the sinister six and blow shit up.

Having said that I would genuinely like to be proved wrong as I love Marc Webb, Emma Stone, Andrew Garfield and think Spider-Man is an awesome character for the movies. So fingers crossed that trailer analysis I just made is off the mark and we see something great.¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Ok, so I'm seeing 2 and 1/2 villians here. One is the 2nd green Goblin, one is Electro, and the other is one of Oscorp's mechs that somehow spiderman defeats, and it seems to nod in the direction of Rhino in design.¬†
Know what I would think would be funny? If Rhino and Shocker kept having cameos in each movie, as like a 5 minute comedy relief, being like the Abbot and Costello of Spider-Man Villains.
It's sad that in Spider Man 3 Venom replaced Vulture. Vulture would have fit in more as a villian in that movie, about stealing people's youth. That would have led to a more appropriate storyline of forgiveness. You would have had 3 very different villians that all wore green!
THEN, in contrast to the heros learning forgiveness, either have venom be the villian in the next movie who turns good to fight, I dunno Carnage, or make the movie more about Venom vs Carnage than Spider-Man.
Be cool to see Spider Man join the Avengers, along with Wolverine.

Comment: Spider-man 2 > Amazing Spider-man 2 Enough Said! Not an insult to the new. It has the potential to be good, but its just fact. Spider-man 2 is still on many fans lists as one of the top comic superhero movies of all time. Unless Alfred Molina reprises his role as Doc Ock in future ASM titles, Doc Ock won't feel the same. For those that are aware and those that do not take the time to remember old Spidey movie news, if Raimi was not bullied into putting Venom in the film, we would have had a classic Sinister Six culmination in his universe. That and that is reason alone these new ASM will succeed is culminating in the Sinister Six if Sony doesn't repeat history once more.

I am a massive fan of DC and Marvel what they are releasing is incredible, but I do think Marvel has milked us fans with some of the movies, but still some quality in the quantity.

This and the next Man of Steel movie aka Batman Vs Superman are going to F***ING ROCK! Of course Avengers 2. If you are not a fan of DC or Marvel you are missing out on some great ENTERTAINMENT. Choose sides, and you lose imho.

Comment:
Here is one of my opinions why the Spiderman's CGI looks bad:

* They blew up with the budget, explaning why the rest of the VFXs look awesome.

Comment:
The CGI looks perfect, way better than the previous one. I think it's because of how high quality the cameras are these days, even with a close up of an actual man in a spiderman costume, people would still say 'looks cartoony', even though it's not fucking CGI!¬†

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Difference Between Marvel and DC movies:

1. DC movies have much more real life emotions, Marvel movies are full of terrible coincidences and unnecessary twists and turns.
2.In DC movies hero can be miserable at some instances and its not that the hero always wins,in Marvel the hero's character is over exaggerated.
3.The picture quality and depth of every frame looks more real than the Marvels all sunny day fairy tale stories.
4.The stories are told in more comprehensible manner which are easy to digest and the reasons for something to happen are very obvious and connected,Marvel movies have reprehensible story tracks and feels absolutely fictional.
5.DC has more grown ups attitude in their movies and does not essentially requires Popcorn,Popcorn is must before entering a Marvel Movie !!!!!

Im a big fan of Marvel and DC both, X-Men , Spiderman with Tobey Maguire is my all time favorite movie but this what i felt and i guess everybody does about Marvel and DC.

Adios !!!

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
I've grown up reading Spidey's comics and watching the great animated series, and It breaks my heart to see Hollywood continually making sub standard movies featuring everyone's favorite friendly neighborhood superhero.
The CGI is probably the only thing that's consistently good about the movies. The cast in all of them are more than talented enough, but they're not given good material to work with. I'm not expecting the films to be as good as the The Dark Knight trilogy, but is it too much¬† to ask for the filmmakers to make Peter Parker appear less depressing, and insert more of Spidey's famous wit in the script ! Andrew Garfield isn't the worst choice for the role, but he needs to make his character more likeable than the previous film.
And for the love of God, could they not have picked the biggest tool they could get a hold of, and cast him as Harry Osborn ?!

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
In the original Spider-Man movies, there was no real origin consistency. Peter was bitten by a mutated spider, Goblin was a psycho with uninspired Iron Man armor, Sandman was a freak lab mutation, Venmon an alien, and Octavius stuck with a machine gone wrong. But it seems like for this new universe of the Amazing Spider-Man series - at least from the trailer - they could be setting it up so that some sort of cybernetic/mutative basis behind each empowered villiain. Lizard's gene splicing gas shooter, Doc Ock's tentacles and Vulture's wings, Rhino's armor, even Goblin's jet and Spidey's decidedly non-organic web-shooters: this version of Spider-Man looks like it wants to mix tech AND evolution equally, with Electro maybe as the next quantum step. After that, the logical way to continue the story for the third movie would be creation of the Sinister Six with the full compliment of animalistic villains (add Scorpion, Chameleon, and maybe Shocker for comedy relief). Just one full movie that's straight up pretty much nothing but villain after villain beating down Spider-Man until he just can't get back up. If they establish a consistent origin, they can skip the tedious backstory that bored everybody with Sandman and just get into the action. They can limit that 3rd movie to 1 1/2 hrs if it's just Electro zapping while Vulture holds Aunt May hostage and Scorpion and Rhino rip up the city and Chameleon causes chaos all as a distraction while Dr. Octopus goes after the real prize and Spidey has to race from one end of Manhattan to the other just trying to hold things together.

Then for the 4th movie, continue the bio-tech theme with OzCorp trying creating the ultimate adaptive weapon - possibly utilizing Spidey's DNA (or at least Papa Parker's theories from the first film that Peter and Dr. Conners refined) to create the Venom symbiote. In fact, by waiting to introduce Harry until now, they can practically follow the Ultimate comics storyline, and maybe also set up a fifth movie by hinting that there were a bunch of failed clones of Peter in the process of trying to replicate his DNA for a Clone Saga movie (just imagine the love complications of Gwen Stacey AND Mary Jane who both think they're Peter's only girlfriend and are both right! Imagine it!).

Those are just ideas, Hollywood (but, seriously, I WILL give you that manuscript if you ask!). All I'm saying is that fans prefer a series that's internally consistent (if you don't believe me, google Prometheus), and that by sticking to a coherent set of rules rather than throwing in a new twists just to surprise and shock audiences, it's actually EASIER to write a good story. From the trailer it looks like they've got a good start.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Seriously? You guys want to bring back tobey? The guy who did that rediculous¬† John Travolta strut in 3? the one who never cracks anything resembling the kind of banter that Spiderman is known for during a fight? Mopey, Dopey, cant project his voice Tobey... This movie may not be great, but if you think for a moment that the last guy was a good spiderman, you are looking through rose colored glasses.

Spiderman - Great movie, made super hero flicks fun for a bit.
Spiderman 2 - Better story, better pacing, better villain, Tobey stops trying and drags the movie a bit
spiderman 3 - Too many villains, noone seemed to care that they were even in this movie.

A. Spiderman - Fresh face, still mopey, obviously influence by Nolan movies. Overall a better set up peice.

A Spiderman 2 - Not out yet, seems to be falling into the too many villains area, however style is decidedly shifted away from nolan and into reproducing Comic Book action: Time will tell, but it looks like after 5 movies they may finally be on the right track. If not, Meh. Theres always another super hero movie on the horizon.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: Yeah I get what you're saying, maybe I'm being too critical.  I'm sure the finish product will be better.  Maybe its just me, but I think I would prefer less action even to reduce the need for CGI .  I certainly wouldn't want a stuntman to do all the crazy things I know cg can accomplish, but there is a certain genuine feel I get with action movies that don't use too much CGI.  I suppose it is the new " thing " to use CGI more but I'm a huge Superman fan and waited anxiously for man of steel, and I personally thought they used way too much in that movie too.  So I've come to the realization that all action movies are going in this direction....... Like it or not, I better get used to it . :-)

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: This looks quite excellent and is hopefully sticking¬†closer to the source material (no offense to any of Raimi/McGuire's works at all; they were under too much pressure from Sony, hence the reboot). All the villains hinted at or shown with some positive creative updates/changes that all look good. Electro having a Bluetooth stuck to his head is kind of amusing but fitting.¬†Even if we can't see the Rhino's face when in the armor (which looks like actual armor instead of a suit). Hope the story holds up too, as well as the cast's performances.¬†Only thing I hope we might see is any superhero allies that might eventually come around since let's face it: we all know the Sinister Six team-up is inevitable in Spidey 3 or 4 (or both). Can't wait for May 2014, of which it'll only have 2 weeks to rack up the $$$ and then X-Men: Days of Future Past will come out (ugh, Fox).

Comment: Okay now I'm really excited for this one.¬† Didn't really know what to expect but I like it.¬† It's funny people complaining about the costume (which is like the comics) and the CGI, but hell he is Spider-Man he fights outlandishly, something that you can't really get actors to do because...they aren't Spider-Man.¬† Really if you are going to cry about some of the liberties Hollywood takes with comic/book adaptations just stop watching movies, because what works in a hundreds of page book or several hundred comics doesn't work in movies so there has to be some translation...seriously get over it.¬† I also believe that Andrew Garfield is an infinitly better Spider-man and Peter Parker than Toadey McGuire.¬† I like that they are making him more cocky, because...wait for it...He's Spider-Man, his personality doesn't change when he puts on the suit...he doesn't pull and Supes/Clark and try to act differently.¬† He has every right to be alittle cocky...(until they whack Gwen...probably at the end/middle of this movie)

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Finally a Spider-man movie trailer that does well to convey the plot without shoving all that campy relationship problems in the mix. Never before have I seen so many easter eggs regarding the Sinister Six, and I think it's great that they're trying to make up for the tons of sequel bait that the last movie did. I mean people complained about SM3 having too many villains, but with the Sinister Six being a possibility it really shouldn't be a surprise as to how many they were planning on cram in there.

I like the more iconic comic take on re-designing the suit and it really matches up with Brian Michael Bendis's Ultimate Spider-Man design which I definitely approve.

¬†Before passing final judgement on this movie I for one am interested to see how this plays out.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: Besides the fact it looks like a video game in some parts, OHMYFRIGGINGGOSHTHISLOOKSPERFECTLYAMAZING! Way to distract us with Electro when you really plan on bring in the whole SNISTER SIX! This is an amazing coalition of a bunch of stuff, and I can see already that its going to flow together greatly! This is what the Dark Knight Rises was trying to be in some ways. I love the Sony marvel movies and I don't think this will make me think differently except maybe for some CGI. The first movie made it seem to me like they were going to make the sinister six all humanoid things, like the rhino or vulture, but as we see here they took the technological path. I really think this is a more "realistic" take on Spiderman, somewhat. I mean we can now see how so many villains could sprout up at the same time thanks to Osborne. But I really don't know if their just setting the sinister six up here, putting out rhino and electro early, and then Gwen Stacy's death, and the introduction of the Osborne's, then they'll wait till a 3rd movie to fully establish the sinister six as a whole, but because they market this as his biggest battle ever suggest that they're going to take it full on. I'm so impressed with this trailer, I know I'm making a lot of preconceptions based on a trailer, but its quality and what it entails, I just feel sure that this is going to be a good superhero movie. Disney Marvel Movies and DC Movies, they try to make their movies into different genres: comedy, dark, scifi, fantasy, etc. But this truly feels like a SUPERHERO movie, they don't change the character to match a tone, they change themselves to match the character and their world. I'm usually not a big spidey fan, it's just that this is the first trailer, first anything, that seems it will be a full on action packed straight from the comics movie, but with its own modifications that I feel improve it, for example as I stated earlier, Osborne leading the sinister six. This just seems like it is going to get everything right and I'm super thankful for Sony because they aren't trying to sail tickets using goldilocks with abs or dark cloaks and inhumanly deep voices. What I mean is, their advertising Spiderman and his world, not the actors and producers who are in/made the movie.

Comment:
So, I'm excited. Three villains in one does make it a ¬†bit complicated, but even just as a cartoon watcher I remember there being multiple eps with multiple villains. This series is trying to stay closer to the original story so it makes sense for them to take a big leap like this. As for the graphic complaint....really? These graphics are fantastic. I'm not one for all CG, but to say the graphics are bad is a bit ridiculous. Disney funds this series...which means they have tons of money flowing into this thing. WHICH MEANS that they put tons of money into the CG and it probably could be one of the best CG movies yet.¬†

On one bad note... why is the Rhino metal? Maybe I missed it somewhere along my childhood, but I could have sworn he was all rhino man and grey skinned, not metal.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
This movie looks astonishing, it's a more superior-looking sequel to the previous awesome movie.
To all of the haters & incoming trolls with ridiculous & irrelevant complaints about Andrew Garfield as Spider-Man or Jamie Foxx as Electro, your opinions already don't matter. I have yet to hear one valid complaint about these two actors, & not "oh he's too much of a douche & Twilight-y to be Peter" or "Jamie Foxx is a horrible actor, Electro isn't even black". It's about character, not color, first of all. Tobey Maguire will always have a place in our hearts, but he's not coming back, & he can't, so get used to it! I've heard comments like this so much that I laugh at them now, you guys can continue your pointless bitching while us stronger fans support the hard work of a studio's movie.

Also, about the CGI, it's not even that bad. Obviously they're going to tweak it some more before the release, even the PS4 & Xbox One doesn't have graphics this good.¬†

So yeah, if you're gonna hate, then at least be original with your negative points. Good luck! :)

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Lets hope that this one isn't another angsty emo fest with too large of a focus on awkward, Twilight-esq teen romance. That was the one thing I couldn't stand about the original. Don't get me wrong, I know you can't have a spider-man anything without his famous love stories on the side, but the romance in the first was far too angsty, far too awkward, and dragged on for far too long. Maybe we'll actually get to see some more of spider-man this time.

Call me crazy, but a love story about as well made as wish-fulfilling fanfic written by a horny teenager is not what I'd prefer to see when I go to a superhero movie purported to contain copious quantities of explosions and action.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: So it has Electro, Rhino, Doc Ock's tentacles, Vultures wings, and¬† I can't tell if I saw Goblin or not.... plus Lizard is still alive..... I think I see where this is going, and so does pretty much everyone here: Sinister Six!¬†I am really looking forward to this movie. Plus I also heard rumor that they're going to tie this storyline in with the Avengers and have Andrew Garfield as the amazing Spider-Man in The Avengers 2. It would also be cool if they could put Norman Osborn as Iron Patriot in one of the movies, but I don't think they will since they changed it up and made Rhodey the Iron Patriot in Iron Man 3.But maybe he could hijack The Armor in¬†a later movie or something. I doubt it will be Avengers 2 since the main villain in it is probably going to be Thanos, as seen at the end of Marvel's the Avengers, but maybe in Iron Man 4 or something, or possibly Avengers 3. I'm getting ahead of myself so yeah. Great trailer, looks great, can't wait to see the movie, i'm going to shut up now

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: Setting aside the fact Electro & Obviously Rhino are based off of their Ultimate's look. Rhino being some stupid mechanical robotic Rhinoceros is stupid. I can get over those things. What I can't get over is Harry being the FIRST yes the first Green Goblin. It makes perfect sense for Norman to be the Goblin first. Obviously because he was the first Goblin & secondly, if Norman is dying, the goblin serum would be the best thing for his character. It would make him seem like he's healthier & would give him his life back but with "crazy" side effects... All in all. Movie looks pretty good. That's just my only gripe that really bothers me about this film.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: People know the first 2 spider-man movies were excellent. There were the small group of haters who hated Tobey's lack of humor, and the organic web shooters, but people looked past because the movie's were good. Then Spider-Man 3 came out, the haters rejoiced, because we could no longer defend you. Everyone agreed that movie sucked, and then the trolls came out of hiding and destroyed Tobey and Kirsten. And everyone acted liked that piece of mediocrity reboot was actually better than the first two movies, which are cinematic classics. Andrew is not a good Peter Parker, sorry not sorry. Amazing Spider-Man sucked, and the first two movies were great, so stopping trolling. I hope Amazing Spider-Man 2 is good like Spider-Man and Spider-Man 2, but who knows. The CGI in this trailer looks awful. Though Jamie Foxx and Paul Giamatti are probably the best possible casting, I dislike Andrew's cocky, smug version of Peter.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: 5 down. 1 to go. This trailer is sick as fuck!! It pretty much sums up what I want out of a Spider-Man movie. Just look at it! I didn't find anything "funny" but hopefully the movie itself will have the lolz. Also all the villains seen and referenced in this trailer, holy shit. We got Electro(duh), Rhino, Vulture, Doc Ock, and Green Goblin. That's 5... We only need one more now. XD And the thing I love most that I can see from this trailer is, like Pacific Rim, It's very bright and vibrant! Most of the fighting(not with Electro) looks like it takes place in the day time which is perfect cause I'm tired of action scenes filmed at night in movies for a little bit.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
"His Greatest Battle Begins"?? ...Could this be implying something "Sinister"? That... that's what they were implying?¬†

Looks like  #theamazingspiderman  ¬†gets his own, trapdoor, "Spider Burrow" (Bat Cave), lol (1:07). (Anyone remember "cellar door" from the comics?) Also, we'll see Ma and Pa Parker's final flight (with an on-board fight as well? 1:42), rather than another Stacy death (too soon, IMO). Though I _am_ a bit concerned about what's going on at 2:04.

Can't wait to see who they cast as  #TheVulture  ,  #DocOck  , (1:15) and whoever might help Spidey in his upcoming battle (Black Cat?)

So far, except for the  #Greengoblin  costume (again?), and maybe even the mecha¬†  #Rhino  , I'm all aboard this one. Yeah, they could'a saved some of these reveals for the film, and could'a named the movie "Spectacular" or "Peter Parker", etc., but this trailer and movie looks amazing.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
I disliked the previous film and I'm disappointed to think that I may dislike this one as well. I was really hoping this movie would be closer to the animated series, as that's where my taste for the Spider-Man series is.

If this new franchise is closer to the comics then congrats to the director, but I've never really read the comics (except in the newspapers and I also have one book with Venom) and I have always favoured the Animated Series more.

Of course, I might give it a try but I have a strong feeling I will hate it.

So, lets do head counts here..
A. Spiderman will fight Electro, Rhino, and Green Goblin Jr. in TASM2.
B. But in the trailer there are Vulture's wings and Doc Ock's Tentacles and we can see Norman Osborn the Real Goblin is sick there.
C. Also, there is a spoiler in some web that the daily buggle news stated some bank has been robbed and attacked by shockwave beam that rattles and that must be The Shocker.
D. Dont forget The Lizard from TASM1 he is still alive in jail and the guy who visited him able to teleport like The Mysterio.
So, who are the villains will appear or some are cameos or just hinted in TASM2 :¬†
1. Electro.
2. Rhino.
3. Green Goblin Jr.
4. Vulture.
5. Doctor Octopus.
6. Green Goblin.
7. Lizard.
8. Shocker.
9. Mysterio.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment: I feel like the Sinister Six is where is this leading up to. Electro is already in this movie. They show Dr. Octopus's arms and the Vultures wings, and they claim they can create more. Also, Rhino's suit looks mechanical so he could be a prototype to see if the mechanical arms and wings would work properly with a human host. In the first movie, we know Dr. Connors is hearing voices, so we can guess Mysterio is behind it. They would only need to bring in Sandman and Kraven (or the Hobgoblin?). I, personally, would love to see Black Cat in the Spiderman movies but introducing the Sinister Six will give them the opportunity to not pull a Spiderman 3.

Title: THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 - Official Trailer (HD)
Comment:
Yes there are too many villains, but you guys have to realize that's how it was in the comics. In the comic books Spiderman would fight the Goblin in the morning and battle with Venom that same evening. If each movie only focused on one villain there would have to be over 8 films, not to mention all the actors/actresses aging. Then people would complain about THAT. THEN folks would complain that their favorite villain (or hero) didn't make it to the big screen!¬†

The bottom line is stop complaining and just wait and see! This might be good. The trailer looks amazing.
